Nous offrons même une allocation annuelle pour que tu aies ce dont tu as besoin pour te créer un confortable bureau à distance.GOÛTE À LA VRAIE FLEXIBILITÉ: Nous croyons fermement au pouvoir de la flexibilité pour favoriser tes réalisations professionnelles et ton épanouissement personnel. C'est pourquoi nous offrons une gamme variée d'options flexibles adaptées pour répondre à TES besoins et préférences.REJOINS UNE ÉQUIPE QUI PREND VRAIEMENT SOIN DE TOI: nos employé·e·s incarnent un véritable esprit d'attention et de soutien. Il est remarquable de constater leur engagement inébranlable à s'entraider. Ils se soutiennent mutuellement avec une véritable empathie, offrant un coup de main et de la compréhension chaque fois que tu en as besoin.Si tu as été interpellé·e par ce que tu viens de lire, on a encore plus de chose à te partager !Tu te demandes surement quelle est la prochaine étape? Notre équipe Talent est impatiente de communiquer avec toi. Après cela, tu auras la chance de rencontrer ta future équipe et de te lancer dans une évaluation Atman, nous permettant de découvrir tes talents et points forts.Rejoins-nous pour contribuer à un monde où chacun·e se sent vu·e, entendu·e et valorisé·e.

Neptune Bulk Terminals (Canada) Ltd., a leading bulk material export facility located on the North Vancouve waterfront, is actively seeking an Operational Technology Specialist to join our IT team. The successful candidate will combine tactical expertise and improve operational excellence across our terminal operational technologies. In this newly created role, the Operational Technology Lead, IT (“OT Lead”) will have the opportunity to partner with business stakeholders in the operations in the terminal with the support of the IT Director. ResponsibilitiesThe OT Lead will be responsible for enabling the successful implementation of the technology roadmap for the terminal OT network in collaboration with the IT Director and their operations including working to optimize the terminal OT/IT systems support, maintenance and advancement of its network, servers and HMI control technology.. The primary responsibilities will include implementing the governance structure for OT operations, managing vendor relationships, change management and consultant management of IT/OT systems, programs, and requirements needed for all technical operations. Cyber security is a critical component of governing the environment and the OT network systems. This is a full time position, reporting to the Director of Information Technology. QualificationsBachelor's degree in computer science or a relevant field; relevant field is preferred or equivalent experience. • Minimum 10 years’ progressively responsible experience in information technology. • Minimum five years’ experience in a leadership role, including the ability to establish and execute against industry best practice performance metrics. • Minimum of 5-10 years of experience in networking and OT networks, switches, Cisco, and UCS servers, Scada & HMI control systems (i.e.: Rockwell) • Proven record of accomplishment in project management and leadership roles. • Strong technical acumen and adept problem-solving, excellent communication skills and interpersonal abilities. • Self-motivated with the capability to work both independently and within a team

Company DescriptionOceanaGold is a growing intermediate gold and copper producer committed to safely and responsibly maximizing the generation of Free Cash Flow from our operations and delivering strong returns for our shareholders.We have a portfolio of four operating mines: the Haile Gold Mine in the United States of America; Didipio Mine in the Philippines; and the Macraes and Waihi operations in New Zealand. The gold, copper, and silver we produce are essential to the renewable energy and transport sectors, life-saving medical devices and technology which connects communities around the world. Software Engineering ManagerAt Medeloop, we are revolutionizing health research by providing a comprehensive data-linking infrastructure and leveraging the power of machine learning and big data analytics to accelerate breakthrough discoveries in disease research. Health and medical data is wasted and we are solving that problem for patients and researchers. Our medical multi-modal data linkage platform links, intakes, and exchanges diverse data types, enabling researchers to access and analyze harmonized data using no-code analytical tools and traditional programming languages. By harnessing world-class machine learning and artificial intelligence algorithms designed to generate and test new research hypotheses on real-world data, Medeloop is driving the discovery and development of new therapies. Join us to be a part of a well-funded, early-stage startup at the forefront of changing the nature of healthcare for the better.Job SummaryAs the Software Engineering Manager at Medeloop, you will lead a team of talented engineers in designing, developing, and maintaining cutting-edge software solutions. You will drive the end-to-end software development lifecycle, from gathering requirements to deployment. Your extensive experience in software development, project management, and leadership will be essential as you guide the team towards successful project delivery. Additionally, your passion for innovation and continuous learning will enhance our development processes and tools, ensuring the highest level of productivity and efficiency.Role & Responsibilities Technical Leadership:Provide technical leadership and guidance to the engineering team.Utilize expertise in languages such as JavaScript, Python, Java, or similar to drive the development of robust and scalable software solutions.Oversee the design, development, and deployment of mobile and web applications, backend services, and data-driven solutions.Ensure adherence to best practices and coding standards across all projects.Team Leadership and Mentoring:Lead and mentor engineering teams, fostering a collaborative and inclusive work environment.Communicate technical concepts effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.Set clear goals, prioritize tasks, and drive the team toward successful project delivery.Project Management:Manage software projects using Agile or Scrum methodologies, ensuring timely delivery and within budget.Coordinate cross-functional teams to deliver software projects on time and with high quality.Assess project risks and implement strategies to mitigate them effectively.Problem-Solving and Data Experience:Identify and solve complex technical problems related to mobile and web apps, backend infrastructure, and data systems.To manage and analyze large datasets, use data processing and analytics tools (e.g., SQL, Pandas, Spark).Implement data storage solutions and pipelines to support scalable and reliable data operations.Leadership in Mobile Application Engineering:Lead or influence mobile application engineering teams, driving technical decisions and fostering a collaborative team environment.Utilize expertise in native and cross-platform mobile app development frameworks to guide the development process.Note: Primary mobile application focus is iOS.RequirementsBachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, a related field, or equivalent experience.3+ years of experience in leading and mentoring engineering teams.5+ years of experience in software development with proficiency in JavaScript, Python, Java, or similar languages.Experience with native and cross-platform mobile app development frameworks (e.g., SwiftUI, React Native, Flutter) and web development technologies (e.g., HTML/CSS, React, Angular).Strong understanding of backend infrastructure, including databases (e.g., SQL, NoSQL), server-side frameworks (e.g., NestJS, Django), and cloud platforms (e.g., AWS).Proven track record in project management methodologies such as Agile or Scrum.Experience in troubleshooting complex technical issues and implementing effective solutions.Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively within a team environment.Passion for innovation and continuous learning, with a proactive approach to improving development processes and tools.We offer a competitive salary, company equity, fully remote work environment, flexible work schedule, and most importantly, you WILL have an opportunity to make a significant impact on the healthcare industry. We encourage you to apply if you meet the requirements and are passionate about using data to transform healthcare.

Job role: Director, IT End User Computing Operations
Job Description: At CI, we see a great place to work as one that is a safe place for everyone to have a voice, where people are empowered to take ownership over meaningful work, where there is an opportunity to grow through stretching themselves, where they can work on innovative products and projects, and where employees are supported and engaged in doing so. The Director, IT End User Operations is responsible for the management, design, implementation, operation, and maintenance of all technologies and services which are aligned to deliver a superior end-user experience. The Director will orchestrate and lead all activities related to end-user support including an omnichannel support model utilizing onsite and remote support mechanisms where necessary. She/he will be responsible for all End User Administration including Identity and Access management, and onboarding and offboarding with a strong focus on automation and improving the end-user experience. The ideal candidate will implement best practices with best-in-class end-user solutions to ensure robust infrastructure solutions meets dynamic IT and business needs and requirements.RESPONSIBILITIES:· Planning, implementing and supporting all hardware, software, and services related to end-user’s services. This includes workstation technology, telephony, meeting room collaboration, Single Sign-On, MFA, O365 Suite, and associated security technologies.· Planning and execution of all end-users’ administrative services including IAM, onboarding/offboarding, AD Administration.· Delivery superior end-user support using an omnichannel model that can respond with agility to changing business needs.· Implement and manage a robust Incident and Problem process aligned with the ITIL Framework including associated toolsets, with plans to expand to other ITSM processes.· Ensuring currency, demand/capacity management plans and execution is embedded in all services and functions.· Benchmark, analyze, report on, and make recommendations for the improvement of end-user systems and services.· Communicate technology solutions and opportunities to management and staff.· Provide guidance to technical teams regarding architectural and procedural best practices, in alignment with the enterprise architects.· Lead governance and automation efforts to minimize manual work and ensure transparency in all aspects of the IT infrastructure ecosystem.· Work with internal and external stakeholders to obtain and translate requirements into technical implementations.· Oversee and develop a continuous delivery framework and tools.· Support Disaster Recovery, Business Continuity planning, and testing· Manages change management processes associated with upgrades, maintenance, troubleshooting or installation of new business applications; includes coordinating with business units, impacted customers, and technical teams.· Actively participates as a part of the department leadership team to develop long and short-term strategies, set and achieve measurable goals and objectives, and develop action plans with challenging but realistic deadlines.· Maintain metrics necessary to support KPI and KRI reporting related to infrastructure performance and optimization.· Manage IT staff by recruiting, training and coaching employees, communicating job expectations and appraising their performance.· Participates in the budgeting process to ensure service agreements, equipment contracts and equipment contracts are budgeted for renewals.· Possesses a continuous improvement mindset and proactively looks for opportunities to increase efficiencies, refine processes and cut costs with internal IT processes as well as throughout the business.· Research emerging technologies and attend relevant professional courses/conferences to maintain the currency of skillset.· Manages ongoing vendor relationships and ensures the timely and cost-effective delivery of services and products.· Develop and maintain a robust 24/7/365 support model.· Develops and maintains strong working relationships with peers in IT and the business.AUTHORITIES:· Signing and Purchasing authority with the delegated authority parameters of the organizationQUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS:Experience· 15 years of experience in the IT industry with a focus on end-user compute services, design, implementation and support.· 10 years in a leadership role within IT· Extensive experience in a hybrid service model (Contact Center, Onsite Support and Remote level support)· Experience in technologies that enable end-users (O365, Collaboration Tooling, Single Sign-On)· Experience with IAM· Experience with Security Tooling (MFA, Anti-Virus, DLP etc)· Experience with delivery of end-user services through automation, Machine Learning and AI.· Experience in ITSM processes and policies and ITSM tooling· Experience with large scale deployment and transformation· Prior experience with information technology in a financial institution preferred.Education/Training· Bachelor’s degree within a business, computer science or equivalent experience· Industry Related Certifications (ITIL, Windows, etc.)Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities· Knowledge of a broad range of end-user technologies and new trends in the space· Keen ability to work through custom requirements for business units, but create a healthy balance of implementation against standards.· Must be able to demonstrate leadership of infrastructure change and transformation programs· Performance analysis, troubleshooting and remediation techniques· Excellent leadership, communication and organization skills with a results-oriented mindset· Strong strategic planning and transformation discipline, with experience building and communicating business cases for technology change· Demonstrated ability to build strong relationships with both business and IT stakeholders and leaders, as well as related IT project and operations teams· Grasp of current and emerging technologies and trends, with the ability to rapidly assess and apply new and emerging technologies· Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to communicate effectively at all levels of the organization· Ability to assess necessary activities and prioritize for completion of assignments using excellent time management, prioritization skills and work ethic· Strong analytical problem-solving ability· Self-starter with the ability to work independently or as part of a project team· Demonstrates advanced consulting and client management skills· Exhibits solid relationship and managerial leadership abilitiesWORKING CONDITIONS:· During peak periods, an irregular work schedule may be expected· Available on an on-call basis for escalation purposesWHAT WE OFFER Modern HQ location within walking distance from Union StationFlexible & Hybrid Work ProgramEquipment Purchase ProgramTraining ReimbursementPaid Professional DesignationsEmployee Share Purchase Program (ESPP)Corporate Discount ProgramEnhanced group benefitsParental Leave Top–up programFitness membership discountsVolunteer paid DaysComplimentary vending machines We are focused on building a diverse and inclusive workforce. Company DescriptionExperience something Brilliantly Different with a career at MUFG Investor Services.  Who are we? Company DescriptionWelcome to a place where people are at the heart of everything we do. Welcome to people with an inspiring vision and who seek stimulating challenges. At CIMA+, you’ll find a place where you’ll have many opportunities to learn and develop while working on engaging projects. We are a firm 100% owned by its employees and we value a collaborative and entrepreneurial mindset. You will have the flexibility to manage your work on your own terms and define what work-life balance means to you. When you join CIMA+, we welcome you to a place that you can call home.Job DescriptionFrom its Quebec City office, CIMA+ is looking for a computer technician in user support to provide on-site and remote support for all CIMA+ offices. Working closely with the IT team and with the required supervision, the technician will be called upon to provide technical support to users experiencing difficulties with hardware and applications. At CI, we see a great place to work as one that is a safe place for everyone to have a voice, where people are empowered to take ownership over meaningful work, where there is an opportunity to grow through stretching themselves, where they can work on innovative products and projects, and where employees are supported and engaged in doing so.   This position requires a professional committed to providing outstanding support to Corporate Applications, CI Institutional, Internal/External system feeds to various vendor and data analytics systems. The successful candidate will be a dedicated team-oriented individual with an excellent understanding of investment management industry projects and the related technology.  RESPONSIBILITIES:  Interface with Project Team(s), other BSAs and developers, as well as with other technical teams, to identify, document and manage the business requirements/specifications for various projects and support those processes, that could be cross functional and technically complex. Responsible and accountable for the business requirements/specifications to be complete, correct, consistent, concise, achievable and to obtain sign off from the business stake holders. Establish/maintain partnerships with business users in order to determine optimal solutions, automation and alternatives for various business and systems needs to ensure clients make informed decisions. Provide overall business/systems support for Production and User Acceptance Test environments. Ensure continued integrity of existing production systems. Ad-hoc reporting for business users. Investigative support for day-to-day system and business issues. Monthly, Quarterly and Annual support for CI Institutional line of business processing and statement runs on client portal. Provide expert guidance with hands-on help where required to solve complex and challenging business problems to the satisfaction of key stakeholders. Set stakeholder expectations appropriately. Share complex concepts with non- technical audiences. Collaborate with project team on issue management and help coordinate resolution. Organize and participate in stakeholder meetings Initiate and lead on support items and projects tied to vendors and management surrounding that Chair and facilitate meetings where appropriate and distribute minutes to Support team members and extended business teams Document and follow up on important actions and decisions from meetings Help to ensure project deadlines are met Undertake project and support tasks as required Help ensure project and support task adheres to JIRA framework and documentation is maintained appropriately. Gather stakeholder feedback and document new requirements as user stories in JIRA Help to ensure stakeholder views/expectations are managed Facilitate meetings with the support and project teams to review/refine JIRA backlog Help define the sprint schedule with support/project team Report on weekly targets, anticipated and existing blockages, progress towards project milestones Will function in an agile team environment and may be involved with planning and executing test cases and vendor system upgrades  QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS:  Experience  5 years experience as an IT support subject matter expert within the Investment Management, Financial or Brokerage industry. Education/Training  College/University graduate in Business Administration, Computer Science or equivalent. Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities  Extensive experience in business/systems analysis for portfolio management/back-office systems within the Investment Management industry Working experience with Corporate Systems in HR and Finance along with vendor management an asset Familiarity with multi-platform environments such as Windows, UNIX, Amazon AWS, Linux/REDHAT. Good knowledge of database design, data mining, and querying using SQL Strong knowledge of investment and wealth management functions: portfolio management/administration, portfolio modeling, performance accounting, performance reporting/attribution, back-office, order and trade management In-depth understanding of various investment products, market practices, securities operations, compliance and regulatory requirements, industry trends Ability to confidently and professionally deal with vendor and employees at a variety of levels Strong customer service orientation, leadership and decision-making skills Creative, adaptable, resilient, self-directed, innovative, results oriented Excellent organizational, problem-solving and critical thinking skills Superior time management skills and ability to manage multiple priorities/deadlines Excellent oral and written communication skills Ability to work independently and as a team member Good interpersonal and team skills  CI Financial is an independent company offering global wealth management and asset management advisory services through diverse financial services firms. Since 1965, we have consistently anticipated and responded to the changing needs of investors. We are driven by a commitment to provide individuals and institutions with the highest-quality investments and advice. Our commitment to the highest levels of performance means that whatever their position, CI employees must be comfortable in a fast-paced environment that will stretch them to tap into their highest potential. Employees with a healthy dose of ambition, a desire to commit to a curious mindset for continuous learning, and a willingness to go the extra mile thrive at CI. Job Description: DataVisor is the world's leading AI-powered Fraud and Risk Platform that delivers the best overall detection coverage in the industry. With an open SaaS platform that supports easy consolidation and enrichment of any data, DataVisor's solution scales infinitely and enables organizations to act on fast-evolving fraud and money laundering activities in real time. Its patented unsupervised machine learning technology, advanced device intelligence, powerful decision engine and investigation tools work together to provide guaranteed performance lift from day one. DataVisor's platform is architected to support multiple use cases across different business units flexibly, dramatically lowering the total cost of ownership, compared to legacy point solutions. DataVisor is recognized as an industry leader and has been adopted by many Fortune 500 companies across the globe.Our award-winning software platform is powered by a team of world-class experts in big data, machine learning, security, and scalable infrastructure. Perform SAST, DAST, Internal Penetration testing on the Applications and the Infrastructure. Lead SOC2 and PCI Compliance programsRequirements3+ years of industry experience with a proven track record of end-to-end audit prep / compliance ownership in one or more of the following: SOC 2, PCI, HIPAA, ISO 270013+ years experience in Application/Product security roleMust have knowledge / experience with security best practices within AWS (EC2, S3, IAM, VPC, Route53) and other providersSkills in the following areas: Security Compliance, Vulnerability Scanning, Managing PEN testingDemonstrated experience with systems auditing and monitoring to ensure compliance with security policies and standardsUnderstanding of key security concepts such as cryptography, authentication, authorization, security protocols, or security vulnerabilities as applied to web application security and Cloud-based servicesDeep technical understanding of common security vulnerabilities and risks, as well as countermeasures and compensating controlsExperience with IDS/IPS, firewalls, DDoS Prevention, and WAFsSolid understanding of IP networking protocols: IPv4/6, TCP/UDP, DHCP, HTTPS, FTP, etcExperience performing network/security maintenance tasks in the Cloud and highly available 24/7 data centersExperience performing security testing with OWASP guidelines. software·        Prioritize work orders/help desk tickets according to severity·        Escalating complex issues to senior tech support/system analyst for resolution·        Providing guidance and courteousness, and friendlinessQualifications and Abilities:·        Bachelor's degree in computer science / information technology or related certifications such as MCSE and CCNA with Windows Server, AD users and computers, File Server etc.·        Experience with Azure / Office365 / Exchange365·        Experience with VMware·        Experience with property management and POS Founded in 1967, ADGA is a privately owned and operated Canadian company. We employ over 700 highly skilled team members who apply their knowledge and expertise in service delivery of advanced technology solutions for clients in the Defence, Security and Enterprise Computing markets across Canada.Celebrating over 50 years in business, we are proud to be one of Canada’s most trusted professional engineering and consultancy firms. Our clients continue to rely on ADGA to provide subject matter expertise, and quality talent to fulfill their business objectives. We have done so successfully by anticipating and responding to the constant changes in technology and evolving with agility.Our culture of commitment, trust, and accountability guides our business, fosters our growth, and is at the core of our relationships with clients, employees and consultants. Whether your projects are complex, large-scale requirements, or dependable, professional resources to execute on time, and on budget, you can count on ADGA to deliver. We are dedicated to your success.Job DescriptionADGA is looking for a Technical Architect for one of our Government of Canada clients working on aproject to move the existing EMDM service (more specifically the BlackBerry Unified Endpoint Management (UEM) portion to a dedicated BlackBerry cloud hosted environment to improve service stability, scalability, and business continuity.This service is currently hosted on-premises using BlackBerry’s proprietary Unified Endpoint Management (UEM) software. There are several service impacting issues that continue to be experienced with operating the EMDM service in Data Centres which moving to the BlackBerry Cloud would reduce these issues. The proposed resource is to assist in the development, deployment and transition to vendor hosted Blackberry EMDM solution.Responsibilities:Work with stakeholders to implement vendor solutionFacilitate the required technologies to implement the solution to meet technical and business requirementsContribute to the implementation of the technical design of the Cloud solution and transition of usersQualificationsThe proposed resource should demonstrate experience in providing knowledge transfers and cross trainingThe proposed resource should demonstrate experience with writing and communicating in solution development.Experience designing and testing Microsoft Exchange in a classified/secret environment for up to 1500 usersDemonstrated experience with Mobile Threat Defence products such as Lookout MES.Experience supporting and engineering a BlackBerry UEM MDM solution with a BlackBerry Dynamics configuration in a classified / secret environment for up to 1500 users.Experience supporting, engineering, and addressing issues with encrypted email (S/MIME) with BlackBerry Dynamics using Entrust Derived Credentials.Additional InformationHybrid working environmentMust currently hold or be eligible for Secret level Government of Canada clearanceWork-Life BalanceWe strongly support a healthy and productive work-life balance. This starts with a flexible approach to work, and policies designed to support employees through their day-to-day routines and major life events. For example, we offer a Maternity/Parental Top-Up (up to 52 weeks) and a Reservist Leave Top-Up (up to 180 days).Belong@ADGAADGA continuously strives to integrate advanced Diversity, Equity & Inclusion (DEI) approaches and practices into our work culture. Our employee-based DEI Committee explores activities and invites discussions that foster an environment where all employees feel valued, respected, and heard.CompensationAbove and beyond our commitment to offer a competitive base salary, ADGA has a company-wide profit-sharing plan for all full-time and part-time employees.Comprehensive Benefits and Total RewardsWe offer a comprehensive benefit program, providing employees with the choice between base or enhanced plans. Depending on the plan, ADGA pays for Health & Dental, a Health Spending Account, Short-Term Disability, an Employee Assistance Program, and a Telemedicine service. Also offered: discounts on gym memberships, 5,000+ perks through Perkoplis, a Deferred Profit Sharing Plan, and access to a wide range of other employee-centric services and savings programs.

At CI, we see a great place to work as one that is a safe place for everyone to have a voice, where people are empowered to take ownership over meaningful work, where there is an opportunity to grow through stretching themselves, where they can work on innovative products and projects, and where employees are supported and engaged in doing so.   This position requires a professional committed to providing outstanding support to Corporate Applications, CI Institutional, Internal/External system feeds to various vendor and data analytics systems. The successful candidate will be a dedicated team-oriented individual with an excellent understanding of investment management industry projects and the related technology.  RESPONSIBILITIES:  Interface with Project Team(s), other BSAs and developers, as well as with other technical teams, to identify, document and manage the business requirements/specifications for various projects and support those processes, that could be cross functional and technically complex. Responsible and accountable for the business requirements/specifications to be complete, correct, consistent, concise, achievable and to obtain sign off from the business stake holders. Establish/maintain partnerships with business users in order to determine optimal solutions, automation and alternatives for various business and systems needs to ensure clients make informed decisions. Provide overall business/systems support for Production and User Acceptance Test environments. Ensure continued integrity of existing production systems. Ad-hoc reporting for business users. Investigative support for day-to-day system and business issues. Monthly, Quarterly and Annual support for CI Institutional line of business processing and statement runs on client portal. Provide expert guidance with hands-on help where required to solve complex and challenging business problems to the satisfaction of key stakeholders. Set stakeholder expectations appropriately. Share complex concepts with non- technical audiences. Collaborate with project team on issue management and help coordinate resolution. Organize and participate in stakeholder meetings Initiate and lead on support items and projects tied to vendors and management surrounding that Chair and facilitate meetings where appropriate and distribute minutes to Support team members and extended business teams Document and follow up on important actions and decisions from meetings Help to ensure project deadlines are met Undertake project and support tasks as required Help ensure project and support task adheres to JIRA framework and documentation is maintained appropriately. Gather stakeholder feedback and document new requirements as user stories in JIRA Help to ensure stakeholder views/expectations are managed Facilitate meetings with the support and project teams to review/refine JIRA backlog Help define the sprint schedule with support/project team Report on weekly targets, anticipated and existing blockages, progress towards project milestones Will function in an agile team environment and may be involved with planning and executing test cases and vendor system upgrades  QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS:  Experience  5 years experience as an IT support subject matter expert within the Investment Management, Financial or Brokerage industry. Education/Training  College/University graduate in Business Administration, Computer Science or equivalent. Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities  Extensive experience in business/systems analysis for portfolio management/back-office systems within the Investment Management industry Working experience with Corporate Systems in HR and Finance along with vendor management an asset Familiarity with multi-platform environments such as Windows, UNIX, Amazon AWS, Linux/REDHAT. Good knowledge of database design, data mining, and querying using SQL Strong knowledge of investment and wealth management functions: portfolio management/administration, portfolio modeling, performance accounting, performance reporting/attribution, back-office, order and trade management In-depth understanding of various investment products, market practices, securities operations, compliance and regulatory requirements, industry trends Ability to confidently and professionally deal with vendor and employees at a variety of levels Strong customer service orientation, leadership and decision-making skills Creative, adaptable, resilient, self-directed, innovative, results oriented Excellent organizational, problem-solving and critical thinking skills Superior time management skills and ability to manage multiple priorities/deadlines Excellent oral and written communication skills Ability to work independently and as a team member Good interpersonal and team skills  CI Financial is an independent company offering global wealth management and asset management advisory services through diverse financial services firms. Since 1965, we have consistently anticipated and responded to the changing needs of investors. We are driven by a commitment to provide individuals and institutions with the highest-quality investments and advice. Our commitment to the highest levels of performance means that whatever their position, CI employees must be comfortable in a fast-paced environment that will stretch them to tap into their highest potential. Employees with a healthy dose of ambition, a desire to commit to a curious mindset for continuous learning, and a willingness to go the extra mile thrive at CI. solutionNetwork Monitoring SoftwareOffice 365 migration and administrationWhy Work at AudienceView:We’re a global leader in live events technology. It offers features such as collaborative coding, real-time multiplayer editing, and the ability to build, test, and deploy directly from the browser. Perform QA functions for any issue resolution from support calls. Develop Reports using SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS). Create datasets to analyze and recreate issues reported by customers. Facilitate positive proactive working relationships with customers and internal resources. Implement and improve remote monitoring tools for our customer’s systems. Utilization of the Support Knowledgebase and Ticketing System to troubleshoot issues. Ability to diagnose and troubleshoot C# code. Ability to dissect stored procedures. Why Patterned Learning LLC?Patterned Learning can provide intelligent suggestions, automate repetitive tasks, and assist developers in writing code more effectively. This can help reduce coding errors, improve productivity, and accelerate the development process.Pattern recognition is particularly relevant in the context of coding. Neural networks, especially deep learning models, are commonly employed for pattern detection and classification tasks. These models simulate human decision-making and can identify patterns in data, making them well-suited for tasks like code analysis and generation.

Oxa is enabling the transition to self-driving vehicles through an initial focus on the most commercially advanced sector; the autonomous shuttling of goods and people.We are home to some of the world's leading experts on autonomous vehicles, creating solutions such as Oxa Driver, equipping vehicles with full self-driving functionality; Oxa MetaDriver, using Generative AI to accelerate and assure the safety of deployments; and Oxa Hub, a set of cloud-based offerings for autonomous fleet management. Our technology is being deployed across the UK and the U.S, and we're partnering with a fast-growing ecosystem of operators, vehicle OEMs and equipment makers serving autonomous transportation globally as it advances.Based in Oxford, and with offices in Canada and the U.S, Oxa was founded in 2014 and is  growing rapidly (350+ ‘Oxbots' to date). Our purpose is to change the way the Earth moves, through an uncompromising focus on safety, efficiency and explainability of our AI approaches. The company has attracted $225 million from leading investors so far, with $140 million raised in the last Series C funding round in January 2023.What will we offer you?A unique 2-year learning opportunity to work in multi-disciplinary and diverse technology teams, with exposure to the entire stack for our autonomy platforms that will give you the best platform for a career with us here at Oxa.Working closely with world-leading experts in the technology that powers our self-driving vehicles.The best cutting edge training available in autonomous vehicles technology and software development.Hands-on experience working on autonomous vehicles in multiple domains running on Oxa's world-leading Autonomy platform.We'll upgrade your coding abilities to work on the most challenging problems and contribute to the autonomy platform right from the start.Scope to work on individual projectsBe a part of a fast-paced work environment that will constantly challenge you to learn and develop.Work on products that have clear customer benefits .The opportunity to have a well rounded foundation for a career in software development and the autonomous vehicles industry. RequirementsWhat you will need to get in:You will need to be a student in the final year of an Undergraduate or Master's degree in STEM or recently graduated from one with a GPA of 3.3 or higher. Alternatively, you can have equivalent experience. (We determine whether you are on track for a 3.3 GPA based on your grades from your most recently completed year of academic study.)Demonstrable Programming skills (in any language but keen to learn c++ and some python ).Analytical and numerical problem solving. Extra kudos for any of the following:Extra curricular software or robotics projects.Experience with: C++ and PythonUnix-based operating systems  We are passionate in ensuring we have the right candidates onboard to solve one of the hardest challenges out there . We're looking for people who :Are Purpose driven and passionate about working on and building technology that will make the earth move.Are enthusiastic about technology and have a willingness to tackle the largest and most complex problems.Have strong technical and problem solving abilities.Enjoy working with others and as part of a team. Have great communication skills.Value getting things done.Have great energy and value velocity - we don't wait for tomorrow. Are humble "learn it alls" and keen to know about the whole technology stack. Are forever young - curious , adventurous , ambitious and always have fun. Have obsessive customer focus and deliver the best products for customers. The Candidate Journey:  Multi-Step and Two-WayNo-one wants to feel like a square peg in a round hole, so this process is designed to give you every chance to get the measure of us, and us of you. The various stages give you every opportunity to show your unique strengths and qualities, and enables each of us to establish if we're a good fit for the other.  If the fit is good and you're selected, you're then in a position to do great work and thrive, which is what everyone wants.  BenefitsWe provide:Competitive salary, benchmarked against the market and reviewed annuallyHybrid working arrangementsLife InsuranceAD&D InsuranceLong Term Disability InsuranceCritical Illness CoverExtended Health CareDental CoverHealth Spending AccountPersonal Spending AccountEmployee Assistance Program  Our Culture Diversity is a marathon not a sprint! It is a journey with no destination. We are on a mission to unlock the benefits of self-driving technology to every person and organisation on the planet. We are creating an environment where everyone, from any background, can do their best work which put simply is the right thing to do. We hire and nurture those we can learn from, valuing diversity and the innovation that this drives.We apply a neuro inclusive lens to our recruitment process and want each potential Oxbot to enjoy the best experience possible for them. We promote an open and inclusive culture that empowers our Oxbots to bring their whole, authentic selves to work every day. Oxa is proud to be an inclusive organisation and, as such, we require all team members within our recruitment process to understand and deploy best practices focused on de-biasing the whole recruitment cycle.Please share with us any individual needs or reasonable adjustments we may need to make in advance of commencing the interview process with us.Learn more about our culture here.Why become an Oxbot?  Our team of experts in computer science, AI, robotics and machine learning is world-class, and together they're solving the most exciting and important technological challenges of our times. But as well as smarts, Oxbots have heart. Our diverse, multi-cultural crew is guided by a shared vision to bring the myriad benefits of autonomy to our customers and partners. And in a company that celebrates uniqueness as much as skill and experience, they do it with energy, conviction and a healthy dose of excitement, too.  If you are bold, creative and hyper skilled, come and create the future of autonomy with us at Oxa.

About Parallelz:Parallelz enables developers and their existing mobile apps/games, without any SDKs, code changes, or engineering efforts to instantly improve user acquisition, organic virality, new revenue channels, and user experiences and capabilities that were not possible before.With Parallelz, users can access mobile apps instantly, with lossless quality, at full performance, on any desktop or mobile device. The Parallelz platform enables this by transforming existing native mobile apps into fully-native web apps, in real-time, that can be instantly accessible on any browser. Developers can now have a new frictionless way to reach their customers, free from the restrictions and taxations of the existing app stores.Parallelz unlocks millions of existing native mobile apps from their silos and transforms them into a more powerful and valuable asset that is fully web-native. Parallelz’ novel architecture creates a new category of building blocks for the web, enabling mobile apps and their functionality to become a new type of web primitive. This enables mobile apps and their discrete components, functionality, and data to instantly become directly addressable, configurable, and compositable. Furthermore, this enables entirely new types of dynamically personalized, user and ML-generated, synthetic app experiences.Our company is building a new technology platform that enables new ways of delivering, discovering, and extending mobile applications -- ways that were never thought possible. We allow developers to – with no modifications to their code – transform existing mobile apps into web-native apps that can run anywhere, all without a walled garden app store.But this technology doesn’t just magically appear, that's where you come in. You will help us build breakthrough technology to enable a radically improved mobile experience for users, giving them more control over their mobile device experience. We are looking for an experienced Platform Engineer to join our team and help build our tooling to enable us to scale.Our founding team and advisors are serial entrepreneurs and technologists from Mozilla, MIT, and former founders of high-growth venture-backed startups. The company is joined by top-tier, global venture funds and angel investors.Job Description:This role will take a holistic view of software and the infrastructure it lives on, finding solutions to scalability and availability goals by understanding the software and leveraging the cloud. This will provide assistance and increase velocity in creating environments (related to integration, QA, UAT, and staging), improve the resilience of our routing and scaling systems, improve scalability, and improve security.Responsibilities will include:– Configure monitoring, alerts, and telemetry– Full stack engineering and development of internal infrastructure and tooling– Development and maintenance of in-house containerisation solutions– Configure CI / CD– Respond to outage events, and track uptime– Assist in creating and maintaining highly available systemsRequirementsMust-Haves:– Familiarity with Linux– Familiarity with Kubernetes– Familiarity with shell scripting– Familiarity with AWS– Familiarity with monitoring solutions (Prometheous preferred)– Familiarity with load balancing– Familiarity with message queues– Familiarity with high availability design patterns– Familiarity with a language such as Bash, Python, Java, Go, Typescript, or Javascript– Familiarity with infrastructure as code (IaaC), such as Ansible, Terraform, Puppet, Chef, AWS CDK, and Pulomi

This starts with a flexible approach to work, and policies designed to support employees through their day-to-day routines and major life events. For example, we offer a Maternity/Parental Top-Up (up to 52 weeks) and a Reservist Leave Top-Up (up to 180 days).Belong@ADGAADGA continuously strives to integrate advanced Diversity, Equity & Inclusion (DEI) approaches and practices into our work culture. Our employee-based DEI Committee explores activities and invites discussions that foster an environment where all employees feel valued, respected, and heard.CompensationAbove and beyond our commitment to offer a competitive base salary, ADGA has a company-wide profit-sharing plan for all full-time and part-time employees.Comprehensive Benefits and Total RewardsWe offer a comprehensive benefit program, providing employees with the choice between base or enhanced plans. Depending on the plan, ADGA pays for Health & Dental, a Health Spending Account, Short-Term Disability, an Employee Assistance Program, and a Telemedicine service. Voici quelques raisons supplémentaires pour te convaincre :TRAVAILLE À TES PROPRES CONDITIONS: Nous pensons que le travail doit s'adapter à notre vie, et non l'inverse. Que tu préfères travailler dans le confort de ta maison, de notre bureau ou même en explorant le monde, le choix t'appartient. Nous offrons même une allocation annuelle pour que tu aies ce dont tu as besoin pour te créer un confortable bureau à distance.GOÛTE À LA VRAIE FLEXIBILITÉ: Nous croyons fermement au pouvoir de la flexibilité pour favoriser tes réalisations professionnelles et ton épanouissement personnel. C'est pourquoi nous offrons une gamme variée d'options flexibles adaptées pour répondre à TES besoins et préférences.REJOINS UNE ÉQUIPE QUI PREND VRAIEMENT SOIN DE TOI: nos employé·e·s incarnent un véritable esprit d'attention et de soutien. Il est remarquable de constater leur engagement inébranlable à s'entraider. A career that gives you purpose. A company that stands up for you. A team where you can be yourself. Sound too good to be true? This is life at Houle. We believe in empowering communities through local projects that positively impact people's lives. We're a passionate group of people who love collaborating on innovative and challenging projects.About This RoleWe are recruiting for an IT Security Analyst to join our Corporate IT team based in Burnaby. Here's how your role will strengthen our team.This position will collaborate with the IT department to develop and implement security policies and procedures, investigate security incidents, and ensure smooth operations of all IT systems from a security perspective across Houle office locations and job sites.Your ResponsibilitiesIdentify and address vulnerabilities in network, applications, infrastructure, and source code vulnerabilities leveraging appropriate security toolsCoordinate the resolution of risks from penetration testing and vulnerability scanning activitiesSupport implementation, maintenance, and improvement of security tools such as SIEM, EDR/XDR, security Firewalls, Spam and Web filtering, Access control, Mobile security etc.Conduct risk assessments, threat modelling, privacy assessments and information security reviews on projects and all existing technology and systemsAssist in regularly assessing the strength of the organization's IT security governance and current processes, procedures, and technical security controls best practices, and propose, and implement initiatives to remediate control gaps to reduce enterprise riskYour Experience And SkillsBachelor's degree in computer science, or equivalent training or educationMinimum 4 years related IT experience in an Enterprise IT environment, with recent relevant experienceCurrently hold or working towards relevant Professional IT Security Certifications (CISSP, etc.)Excellent written and verbal communication skillsStrong aptitude to take on new challenges and learn innovative technologiesCollaborative personality and work well with customers and internal team membersAbout HouleAs BC's leading electrical contractor and systems integrator, we believe in delivering safe, reliable power for the future. From hospitals and universities, to airports, shipping terminals and shopping centres, our electrical and technology professionals proudly provide innovative solutions that create value for our customers every day.Since 1944, we've been dedicated to our craft, committed to quality workmanship, and building teams that thrive. Driven by purpose and connected through collaboration, our focus on people guides our success in delivering some of the most exciting infrastructure projects in the province.As a certified Great Place to Work and Best Managed company, we have been recognized for our efforts in creating a safe and inclusive work environment.Why join our team?We emphasize having a work-life balance - We offer flexible work schedules and a competitive vacation policy.Continuous development is a top priority - Whether you're looking for a corporate career or a career in the field, you are supported with access to tools and training for development and growth.Our employee benefits prioritize your financial, physical, and mental well-being - From RRSP matching to health and wellness reimbursements and additional Houle days off, we've got you covered.We have many exciting project opportunities - With many projects on the go around BC, we're certain you will find countless ways to bring communities to life.We have fun! Connection is key at Houle, from industry events to themed office gatherings, we never miss an opportunity to celebrate. Join us for our summer bbqs, potlucks, charity fundraisers, community volunteering, and many more fun events!A safe space for everyone - We celebrate diversity and are proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We're committed to diversity and inclusion and strive to foster, cultivate and preserve a culture of belonging for all employees.Salary range: $68,000-$90,000 per year plus a competitive total compensation package. Actual salary will be commensurate with experience, skills and overall match to the position offered. Let's chat throughout the hiring process and determine the best fit.Sound like a match? We'd love to connect.Please visit https://www.houle.ca/current-career-opportunities/ and click on the listing for IT Security Analyst. The opportunity will remain open until it has been filled.Connect with us on LinkedIn, Instagram, Facebook, and Twitter!

In addition to standard benefits like health and wellness, vacation and retirement savings programs, we also provide other important benefits such as:Training & Development OpportunitiesCareer Advancement PotentialFlexible work optionsCompetitive Compensation including performance-based incentive payMeaningful work towards individual and corporate goals Opportunities to get involved and give back through an employee volunteer programFor Information About These Benefits And More, Click Here.At Servus, our employees are also members. Coursera was launched in 2012 by two Stanford Computer Science professors, Andrew Ng and Daphne Koller, with a mission to provide universal access to world-class learning. It is now one of the largest online learning platforms in the world, with 142 million registered learners as of December 31, 2023.Coursera partners with over 325 leading university and industry partners to offer a broad catalog of content and credentials, including courses, Specializations, Professional Certificates, Guided Projects, and bachelor’s and master’s degrees. Institutions around the world use Coursera to upskill and reskill their employees, citizens, and students in fields such as data science, technology, and business. Coursera became a B Corp in February 2021.Join us in our mission to create a world where anyone, anywhere can transform their life through access to education. We're seeking talented individuals who share our passion and drive to revolutionize the way the world learns.We at Coursera are committed to building a globally diverse team and are thrilled to extend employment opportunities to individuals in any country where we have a legal entity. We require candidates to possess eligible working rights and have a compatible timezone overlap with their team to facilitate seamless collaboration. As a remote-first company, our interviews and onboarding are entirely virtual, providing a smooth and efficient experience for our candidates.Job Overview:Coursera’s IT Department is responsible for the Corporate tools and technology that are required for the company to operate efficiently and effectively. We are a growing team that plays an integral role in the company’s ability to perform its day-to-day tasks. While supporting an ever-growing number of users with top-tier tools and applications, our IT team is always aiming to achieve the highest goals and produce the best experience possible for our end users.Coursera is looking for a motivated IT Support Specialist to help support our growing team and ensure our staff has the optimal technical working environment. This is an internal support position which requires versatility, attention to detail, a strong sense of urgency and troubleshooting skills. In this role, you will be the front-facing contact to manage IT requests ranging from break/fix issues, SaaS administration, asset management, hardware deployment, user onboarding & offboarding, and some IT project participation. As part of a small IT team, you'll wear lots of hats and gain plenty of valuable experience.The role provides an opportunity to enhance your IT skills by providing first-line support to Courserians with their IT service requirements and needs. The role also allows for the successful candidate to further identify their IT path and align their career aspirations with the different IT fields, from basic computer fundamentals to server administration, application support, and other technology opportunities.Responsibilities:Responsible for Global IT Support for 1500+ systems (95% Mac and 5% Windows & VDI), experience with end-user support by responding to client queries, solving technical problems including client software, hardware and network system problems.Daily duties can include receiving, prioritizing, documenting, routing, scheduling, help with general IT support, deep troubleshooting, documentation as well as A/V needs, project management and resolving any and all internal IT support requests.Conduct New Hire training, including orientation on company IT platforms and tool familiarity, troubleshooting, and configuration assistance.Provide technical assistance to level II team members and act as a liaison with the Systems and Network Administration team(s).Manage hardware in relation to the hardware asset lifecycle and provide support in SaaS asset management such as auditing, access retrieval, etc.Create and maintain knowledge content to promote self-service support and provide feedback and recommendations to improve processes, productivity, and quality of service.Basic Qualifications:2+ years of IT or Desktop Support / System Administration with a demonstrated history of providing exceptional customer service.Extensive experience with configuring & troubleshooting Mac OS & Windows 10 and higher. Experience with various IT tools and SaaS applications: Google Suite, JAMF, Zoom, ServiceNow, Virus Scan, Microsoft Office, Slack, OktaDemonstrated ability to communicate ideas to technical and non-technical audiences in both written and verbal formats.Inquisitive attitude and a desire to learn new things.Preferred Qualifications:Experience with systems/network skills, experience with JAMF and/or Workspace One, ServiceNow, Global Protect, and Okta.Experience in providing training or documenting training guides for non-technical usersIf this opportunity interests you, you might like these courses on Coursera:Service Desk Analyst: Jobs, Courses, Salaries, and Career Paths - https://www.coursera.org/articles/service-desk-analystGoogle IT Support Professional Certificate - https://www.coursera.org/professional-certificates/google-it-supportBachelor of Information Technology from Illinois State - https://www.coursera.org/degrees/bach-information-technology-illinois-techCoursera is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer and considers all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected class.If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, please contact us at accommodations@coursera.org.For California Candidates, please review our CCPA Applicant Notice here.For our Global Candidates, please review our GDPR Recruitment Notice here.

What Vista DoesVista Projects is an integrated industrial engineering firm that helps clients navigate the digital transformation of their projects and operations. Our proven project execution process is based on a “single source of truth” model that eliminates the potential for inefficient engineering designs, cost overruns and project completion delays.Why We Do ItWe believe the world needs industrial projects and that intelligent engineering data can increase the likelihood of innovative solutions getting to market. Over the years, our multi-discipline teams have conceptualized and designed some of the most challenging and successful industrial processing projects in the North American energy sector. Vista has established itself as a trusted industrial engineering partner for all types of projects, from conceptual studies and pilots to large-scale commercial expansions.Where We WorkThe benefits of our approach apply to new asset developments and brownfield optimization projects across several industrial markets. This includes biofuels and produced water treatment to natural gas and petrochemical processing. We headquartered in Calgary and maintain a satellite office in Houston.What You Would Do in This RoleThe IT Support Analyst supports Vista end users’ desktop experience. Duties include:Installing, configuring, and maintaining workstations for end usersInstalling, configuring, and maintaining printers, scanners, and plottersInstalling software Diagnosing, resolving, and documenting software and hardware incidentsUtilizing a ticketing system to track and document software and hardware incidentsCreating end user documentationWorking with vendor support contacts to resolve technical problemsMaintaining the organization’s Active Directory Performing SCCM maintenanceEnsuring the organization’s information governance policies are followedPerforming other duties as requestedRequirementsHigh School DiplomaExperience in MS Windows desktop operating systems and application softwareKnowledge of networking and resolving connectivity issuesKnowledge of Active Directory and SCCM maintenanceStrong verbal and written communication skillsWilling to work varying schedules to ensure coverage within the departmentValid driver’s licenseAbility to pass a criminal background checkPreferredTechnical Certificate, Associate, or Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science0-2 years of experience in a similar roleWhy People Like Working with UsWorking with Vista is a chance to contribute to the type of challenging municipal and industrial projects that the world requires. If that doesn’t excite you, this role likely won’t be a fit.Challenging projects require focus and we enable our people to do their best work with modernized project systems that are based on our leading use of intelligent data-centric execution architecture. Our staff and clients like that it gives them real-time access to validated data shared across all project departments. This fosters project design and business decisions based on a single, authoritative source of truth and provides increased transparency and collaboration with team members and clients, leading to improved engineering quality and a product we can all take pride in.What We OfferAn opportunity with Vista is not just a job; it is a chance to tackle challenging projects with colleagues who are among the most recognized and accomplished in their disciplines.Vista offers all employeesA stimulating, fast-paced and challenging work environment where you will contribute to the interesting municipal and industrial engineering projectsA robust and consistent recruitment process that ensures your colleagues are likeminded and comparably capableAn opportunity to be a part of an entrepreneurial, technically skilled team which has established leadership in innovative engineering solutionsA strong value-based philosophy that provides an informal, close-knit team environment, where you and your family feel like a part of our organization, and not just an employee numberCompetitive compensation and benefits, including a performance-linked variable pay programCompany-sponsored social events and team sportsFlexible work schedules, half-day Fridays and free parkingAn organization that values and encourages diversityHow to ApplyPlease complete the application form below and include a cover letter concisely demonstrating how your skills and experience align with our job posting. By submitting this application, you consent to ourNote: As part of the interview process there will be a technical testing component that will take up to two hours and can be completed at home on your own timeline. Candidates may be required to complete a security clearance procedure prior to receiving an offer.Powered by JazzHRCySll6er2a

solutionNetwork Monitoring SoftwareOffice 365 migration and administrationWhy Work at AudienceView:We’re a global leader in live events technology. Department: IT Job Scope: Reporting to the IT Services Manager, the IT Coordinator is responsible for providing administrative, operational and first-level user support services for Gay Lea Foods’ IT. As an integral member of the IT team, the IT Coordinator is responsible for monitoring support tickets and ensuring the successful completion of daily, weekly and monthly checklists and updates. The T Coordinator responsibilities spans all areas of IT – applications/software, technical support services and infrastructure.Key Responsibilities:  Execute daily, weekly, monthly IT tasks  Monitor IT support tickets - triage, assign, follow-up  Monitor the EDI mailbox  Help provide administrative and functional support for customer EDI portals such as Tungsten, Ariba, iTrade  Log support tickets for warehouse management system (WMS) queue errors  Maintain the hardware asset tracking/management system  Track/manage WMS scanners  Enter IT purchase orders into D365  Assist with regression testing of Microsoft D365 software updates  Administer security account changes in our D365 and WMS applications  Update, maintain, and organize IT documentation  Assist with IT system audits  Perform initial hardware assessments (printers, laptops, etc.)  Transcribe knowledge transfer recordings  Assist with end-user training  Other ad-hoc tasks and projects as requested by Management Qualifications: Solid organizational and administrative skills  Ability to multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment  Excellent attention to detail with a high-level of accuracy  Must be proficient with computers (Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)  Effective communication and interpersonal skills (written and verbal)  Customer-oriented, with a big picture mindset  Ability to work independently and in a team environment with minimal supervision  Gay Lea Foods  is a proud Canadian-owned dairy food and beverage company with a robust portfolio that includes 7 established brands such as Gay Lea Butter, Nordica Cottage Cheese, Ivanhoe Cheese, Salerno Cheese, and Hewitt’s Dairy. Our wide range of products are sold in Retail, Foodservice, Industrial, Co-pack, and Export markets, developed and produced out of our 13 manufacturing facilities in Ontario and Alberta.Delivering high-quality and innovative products - from the consumer favourite Spreadables and North America’s first Smooth™ Cottage Cheese, to Nothing But Cheese™, an innovative snack made with 100% cheese, is what makes us market leaders in our categories. Our grassroots approach to business is what guides our direction and differentiates us from our competitors.Our employees inspire our culture of excellence and entrepreneurship. Manager, Information Technology Oshawa Power Group of Companies is a parent company of fiber optic, district energy and renewable generation businesses, and the local electricity distribution company that supplies electricity to more than 63,000 customers in the city of Oshawa. Located just 45 minutes east of Toronto off the shores of Lake Ontario, Oshawa serves as the economic engine for the Durham Region. Oshawa Power maintains 1000 km of overhead and underground distribution lines within a 150 km2 service territory, operated at 44 and 13.8 kV, supplied by 9 distribution and 3 transmission substations. The organization is committed to the safe, reliable and efficient delivery of electricity through responsible financial management, strategic reinvestment and continuous innovation. About this Opportunity We pride ourselves on fostering a collaborative and inclusive work environment where every team member can thrive and contribute to our collective success. As we continue to grow, we are seeking a high performing Manager of Information Technology to join our team and support our business transformation initiatives. Reporting to the CTO & Director Business Transformation, the Manager of Information Technology is responsible for the effective advancement of information technology infrastructure and services and across the Oshawa Power Group of Companies. This position is responsible for oversight for both IT and OT cyber security, technology projects, resource management and staff supervision, and for effectively engaging with the executive team, business unit leaders, and end users. With a service-oriented mindset and an analytical mind, the Manager energetically partners with the business to drive business value and solutions using technology, with a steady hand to maintain rigour, security and best practices, coupled with creativity and curiosity that is willing to adopt new ideas and technologies. As the successful applicant, you will have the opportunity to be involved with:·        People: o  Responsible for maintaining a high performance, highly motivated, engaged and happy technology team;o  Responsible for working with business owners and SMEs across the organization to support/enhance/implement LOB applications, maintaining excellent working partnerships;o  Manage Service Desk SLOs and ensure that the business is satisfied with reactive work, using proactive planning to minimize incidents;·        Cyber Security:o  Responsible for Cyber Security across the organization, including IT/OT infrastructure, applications, training, business continuity, disaster recovery, risk management, incident response, and compliance;·        Infrastructure:o  Overseeing the design, operation, and maintenance of all technology infrastructure in the organization, both IT and OT;·        Applications:o  Overseeing the planning, operation and maintenance of all enterprise and line-of-business applications, working closely with business owners of each application to provide solutions for business needs and proactive continuous improvement;·        Management:o  Responsible for IT/OT program and project management (in cooperation with PMO);o  Responsible for technology capital and operating budgets, including hardware, software, licensing, expenses, and labour;o  Responsible for all technology vendor management, acting as liaison (along with the IT team) between vendors and the business;WHAT YOU HAVE TO OFFER·        Bachelor’s degree or relevant post-graduate training in Computer Science, Information Systems, or relevant field;·        Minimum five (5) years progressive information systems experience in a leadership capacity;·        Advanced analytical, project management, strategic planning, and cost control skills to ensure effective, timely, and on-budget outcomes;·        Strong knowledge of networking, operating systems, software development cycles, and server architecture;·        Demonstrated proficiency with VPN networks, firewalls, and other aspects of network design and security;·        Strong customer-focused orientation with focus on partnering with the business to provide solutions;·        Analytical with excellent reasoning & decision making skills; ability to conduct research to support decisions and recommendations;·        Ability to energize, convince and motivate;·        Experience in an electrical utility environment considered an asset.WHAT WE HAVE TO OFFERIn addition to working alongside a talented and inspiring team, Oshawa Power offers; ·        Competitive salary commensurate with experience;·        Dynamic and collaborative work environment with a focus on work-life balance;·        OMERS Pension fully vested from date of hire;·        Comprehensive benefits package and paid time off.·        Ontario Government Mobile Data plans;·        Tuition and Fitness reimbursement plans;·        Opportunities for professional development and growth within the company.APPLICATION PROCESSOshawa Power is an equal opportunity employer that embraces and celebrates our collective diversity. We welcome all individuals to apply and do not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, Indigenous/Métis status, or other legally protected status.  Interested and qualified applicants are invited to submit their resume no later than March 22, 2024 by email to: careers@oshawapower.ca *Please include the position title you are applying for in the subject line. We thank all applicants, however only those selected for an interview will be contacted. If you are selected for an interview, please note that you will be required to complete a criminal background check. All applicants must be legally entitled to work in Canada and in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005, should you require accommodation through any stage of the recruitment process, please let us know when we contact you and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Client is looking for contract IT QA Tester to help support the Business Systems Division. The dates for this assignment are from April 2024 up to April 2025 with an option to renew for up to 12 months in 2025/26. This work will be a combination of on-site at Client’s head office at 4515 Central Blvd, Burnaby, BC and remotely.Service Required:The QA Tester will work closely with the Business Systems Division Manager, Supervisor and business clients on the following:Acting as QA tester to test both in-house built systems and vendor systems, including but not limited to: MRI. This is our Housing system.  Regulation and Enforcement Integrated Application (REIA) and NRDE. Both are in-house built systems that require consistent testing.  GIS applications. An example includes Dam Safety.  In house developed APPS. Examples include Residential Indoor Wood Burning and Open Wood Burning.  Databridge. This is a new system being implemented for our Solid Waste System.  Help us to implement automated testing. Requirements skills/qualifications:Strong understanding of the manual and automated testing and principles. Designing test plans, scenarios, scripts, and procedures. Thorough knowledge and experience to troubleshoot and resolve technical issues. Strong understanding of IT infrastructure and interdependencies with enterprise systems, vendor and in-house built systems. Project Management Professional (PMP) designation is not required, however would be considered an asset. Certified ScrumMaster (CSM) and Certified Scrum Product Owner (CSPO) designations are not required, however would be considered an asset. Strong knowledge of Azure DevOps. Thorough knowledge and experience with review/implementation of key PMO processes. Thorough knowledge and experience with implementation of Agile practices and frameworks. Considerable knowledge of information technology components, processes and developments related to the work performed. Ability to document, analyze and assess a variety of information for testing purposes, identify priorities and propose alternative business processes. Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with a variety of internal contacts and to provide advice and assistance on matters related to the work. Ability to communicate effectively orally and in writing and to present proposals in non-technical language. Ability to perform assigned duties under minimum supervision. Ability to act as a liaison between client departments and contractors; assists in the resolution of service problems and issues; provides advice and guidance to other staff engaged on projects of less complexity.

This is a remote position.Junior Research & Development-SQL Developer - Remote Job, 1+ Year ExperienceAnnual Income: $61K - $71KA valid work permit is necessary in the US/CanadaAbout us: Patterned Learning is a platform that aims to help developers code faster and more efficiently. The platform also provides tightly integrated code generation, editing, and output capabilities.Summary of Position:A skilled SQL Developer to join our dynamic team. The SQL Developer will play a crucial role in designing, implementing, and maintaining stored procedures and queries, ensuring efficient and reliable database DevOps process, and developing and maintaining reports using PowerBI. The ideal candidate should have a strong background in SQL development, database design, and PowerBI.Duties & Responsibilities:Design and implement database solutions to meet business requirements Create entity-relationship diagrams (ERDs) and data models Normalize data and ensure data integrity SQL Development:Write efficient and optimized SQL queries for data retrieval, manipulation, and reporting Develop and maintain stored procedures, triggers, and functions Troubleshoot and optimize SQL code for performance Maintain database schema and drive the dev ops process to reliably propagate changes to test and production Data Integration:Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate data from various sources into the database Ensure data consistency and accuracy during the integration process Documentation:Maintain thorough documentation of database schemas, data dictionaries, and processes Document changes and updates to the database environment Troubleshooting and Support:Respond to and resolve database-related issues and incidents promptly Provide support and assistance to end-users and other teams as needed Minimum Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field or equivalent work experience Proven experience as a SQL Developer or similar role Proficiency in SQL programming and database management systems (e.g., Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle, MySQL) Strong knowledge of database design principles and data modeling Experience with performance tuning and optimization of SQL queries Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail Strong communication and collaboration skills Ability to work independently and as part of a team Prefer certification in database management (e.g., Microsoft Certified Database Administrator) Experience with ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes and tools Experience with business intelligence and reporting tools, PowerBI & Data Analysis Expressions (DAX) Knowledge of HIPAA, preferred Ability to deliver effective documentation of projects and tasks Ability to perform comfortably in a fast-paced, high-intensity, deadline-oriented work environment Why Patterned Learning LLC?Patterned Learning can provide intelligent suggestions, automate repetitive tasks, and assist developers in writing code more effectively. This can help reduce coding errors, improve productivity, and accelerate the development process.Pattern recognition is particularly relevant in the context of coding. Neural networks, especially deep learning models, are commonly employed for pattern detection and classification tasks. These models simulate human decision-making and can identify patterns in data, making them well-suited for tasks like code analysis and generation.
